required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Rilematovir (JNJ-53718678) in Adult Outpatients With Respiratory Syncytial Virus (RSV) Infection
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2b Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Rilematovir (JNJ-53718678) in Adult Outpatients With Respiratory Syncytial Virus (RSV) Infection Who Are at High Risk for RSV-related Disease Progression

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of rilematovir compared to placebo with respect to the time to resolution of respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) lower respiratory tract disease (LRTD) symptoms.

detailed_description.textblock: Rilematovir is an investigational RSV specific fusion inhibitor currently in development for the treatment of RSV infection in both adult and pediatric populations. The study will include a Screening period (Day -1 to Day 1), a Treatment period (Day 1 to Day 7/8 [depending on timing of first dose]), and a Follow-up period (Day 8/9 to Day 35). The total study duration of the study for each participant will be up to 35 days. The study will evaluate efficacy and safety of RSV in adult outpatients (18-85 years) who are at high risk of RSV related disease progression and have at least moderate RSV disease. The efficacy assessments include evaluation with electronic patient-reported outcome (ePRO) and the safety assessments include evaluations of physical examinations, vital signs, electrocardiograms, clinical laboratory tests, and adverse events.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Resolution of Respiratory Syncytial Virus (RSV) Lower Respiratory Tract Disease (LRTD) Symptoms as Assessed by Respiratory Infection Intensity and Impact Questionnaire (RiiQ Symptom Scale)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
primary_outcome.description: Time to resolution of RSV LRTD symptoms (that is, cough, short of breath, wheezing, coughing up phlegm [sputum]) as assessed by RiiQ symptom scale score will be reported. RiiQ is a 4-point scale. Each symptom is rated on the scale of 0 to 3 where 0=None, 1=Mild, 2=Moderate, and 3=Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Post-Baseline RSV-related Complications
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with post-baseline RSV-related pulmonary and extrapulmonary complications will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with New Antibiotic Use, or New or Increased Use in Bronchodilator/Nebulizer, Systemic Corticosteroids, or Home Oxygen Supplementation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with new antibiotic use, or new or increased use in bronchodilator/nebulizer, systemic corticosteroids, or home oxygen supplementation will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Unscheduled Outpatient Clinic Visits, Emergency Room Visits or Hospitalization for Respiratory Infection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with unscheduled outpatient clinic visits, emergency room visits or hospitalization for respiratory infection will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Meeting a Composite Endpoint of Either Developing RSV-Related Complications and/or Needing RSV-related Medical Attendance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants meeting a composite endpoint of either developing RSV-related complications (pulmonary & extra pulmonary) and/or needing RSV-related medical attendance will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Adverse Events (AEs) as Measure of Safety and Tolerability
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical study participant administered a pharmaceutical (investigational or non investigational) product. An AE does not necessarily have a causal relationship with the pharmaceutical/biological agent under study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Abnormalities in Clinical Laboratory Tests
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with abnormalities in clinical laboratory parameters (including hematology, chemistry and urinalysis) will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Abnormalities in Electrocardiograms (ECGs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 14
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with abnormalities in ECGs will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Abnormalities in Physical Examination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with abnormalities in physical examination will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Abnormalities in Vital Signs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with abnormalities in vital signs will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Over Time in Severity of the RSV LRTD Symptoms as Assessed by the Participant Using the RiiQ Symptom Scale Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline over time in severity of the RSV LRTD symptoms as assessed by RiiQ symptom scale score will be reported. RiiQ is a 4-point scale. Each symptom is rated on the scale of 0 to 3 where 0=None, 1=Mild, 2=Moderate, and 3=Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Resolution of LRTD Symptoms and 2 Systemic symptoms as Assessed by RiiQ Symptom Scale Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Time to resolution of LRTD symptoms and 2 systemic symptoms (feeling feverish and fatigue) as assessed by RiiQ symptom scale score will be reported. RiiQ is a 4-point scale. Each symptom is rated on the scale of 0 to 3 where 0=None, 1=Mild, 2=Moderate, and 3=Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Resolution of the Overall RSV Symptoms (Upper Respiratory Tract Disease [URTD], LRTD, and 2 Systemic Symptoms) as Assessed by RiiQ Symptom Scale Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Time to resolution of the overall RSV symptoms (URTD [sore throat and nasal congestion], LRTD, and 2 systemic symptoms [feeling feverish and fatigue]) as assessed by RiiQ symptom scale score will be reported. RiiQ is a 4-point scale. Each symptom is rated on the scale of 0 to 3 where 0=None, 1=Mild, 2=Moderate, and 3=Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Resolution of all RSV Symptoms as Assessed by RiiQ Symptom Scale Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Time to resolution of all RSV symptoms as assessed by RiiQ symptom scale score will be reported. RiiQ is a 4-point scale and it can be scored as a mean of all scores (total symptom scale score) or 2 subscales scores that is respiratory symptoms and systemic symptoms. Respiratory symptoms subscale score is the mean of 6 symptoms, that is, 2 URTD symptoms (nasal congestion and sore throat) and 4 LRTD symptoms (cough, wheezing, shortness of breath, and coughing up phlegm/sputum) whereas systemic symptom subscale score is the mean of 7 systemic symptoms (headache, feeling feverish, neck pain, body aches and pain, fatigue/tiredness, interrupted sleep, and loss of appetite). Each symptom is rated on the scale of 0 to 3 where 0=None, 1=Mild, 2=Moderate, and 3=Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Resolution of each Separate RSV LRTD Symptom as Assessed by RiiQ Symptom Scale Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Time to resolution of each separate RSV LRTD symptom as assessed by RiiQ symptom scale score will be reported. RiiQ is a 4-point scale. Each symptom is rated on the scale of 0 to 3 where 0=None, 1=Mild, 2=Moderate, and 3=Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Resolution of Respiratory Infection Symptoms as Assessed by Patient Global Impression of RSV Severity (PGI-S) Scale Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Time to resolution of respiratory infection symptoms as assessed by PGI-S scale score will be reported. PGI-S is a single item patient-reported outcome (PRO) aimed to capture how severe the participant's respiratory infection symptoms at their worst scored that day. PGI-S is a 5-point ordinal response scale ranging from no symptoms today (0), mild (1), moderate (2), severe (3), and very severe (4).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Return to Pre-existing Health (Status) for all RSV Symptoms as Assessed by RiiQ Symptom Scale Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Time to return to pre-existing health (status) for all RSV symptoms as assessed by RiiQ symptom scale score will be reported. RiiQ is a 4-point scale. Each symptom is rated on the scale of 0 to 3 where 0=None, 1=Mild, 2=Moderate, and 3=Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Improvement in RSV Disease as Assessed by Patient Global Impression of Change (PGI-C) Scale Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Time to improvement in RSV disease as assessed by PGI-C scale will be reported. PGI-C is a single item patient-reported outcome (PRO) aimed to capture the participant's perceptions of improvement or deterioration in the severity of RSV symptoms compared to before the participant started taking the study intervention. PGI-C is a 7-point ordinal response scale ranging from much better (3), somewhat better (2), a little better (1), about the same (0), a little worse (-1), somewhat worse (-2), and much worse (-3).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Over Time for the Health-Related Quality of Life (HRQOL) as Assessed by 5 Level EuroQol 5 Dimension (EQ-5D-5L)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D-5L includes 6 questions that provide a profile on 5 HRQOL domains: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each of the 5 dimensions is divided into 5 levels of perceived problems, where Level 1: no problem, Level 2: slight problems, Level 3: moderate problems, Level 4: severe problems and Level 5: extreme problems. It also contains a visual analog scale (VAS) of 'how good or bad is your health today' on a scale ranging from 0 (the best health you can imagine) to 100 (the worst health you can imagine).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Over Time for the RiiQ Impact Scales
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: RiiQ impact scale consists of 3 scales (that is, RiiQ impact on daily activities ranging from 0 [no difficulty] to 3 [great difficulty]; RiiQ impact on emotional scale ranging from 0 [not at all] to 3 [extremely], and RiiQ impact on others scale ranging from 0 [not at all concerned] to 3 [extremely concerned]).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Return to Usual Health as Assessed by the 'Adult RSV Return to Usual Health' Question
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Time to return to usual health as assessed by the 'adult RSV return to usual health' question (that is Have you returned to your usual health today? with an option of "Yes" or "No") will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Return to Usual Activities as Assessed by the 'Adult RSV Return to Usual Activities' Question
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Time to return to usual activities as assessed by the 'adult RSV return to usual activities' question (that is Have you returned to your usual activities today? with an option of "Yes" or "No") will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to No or Mild Impact of RSV-related Disease on Daily Activities, Emotions, and Social Relationships as Assessed by RiiQ Impact Scales
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Time to no or mild impact of RSV-related disease on daily activities, emotions, and social relationships as assessed by RiiQ impact scales will be reported. RiiQ impact scale is to understand the impact of an acute episode of RSV infection using the 3 scales (that is, RiiQ impact on daily activities ranging from 0 [no difficulty] to 3 [great difficulty]; RiiQ impact on emotional scale ranging from 0 [not at all] to 3 [extremely], and RiiQ impact on others scale ranging from 0 [not at all concerned] to 3 [extremely concerned]).

secondary_outcome.measure: RSV Viral Load Area Under the Curve (AUC) from Immediately Prior to First Dose of Study Intervention (Baseline) Through Days 3, 5 and 8
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Days 3, 5 and 8
secondary_outcome.description: RSV viral load AUC from immediately prior to first dose of study intervention (baseline) through Days 3, 5 and 8 will be reported. RSV viral load will be assessed by quantitative real-time reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR) assay of nasal mid turbinate swab samples.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline over Time in RSV Viral Load
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Day 21
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline over time in RSV viral load will be assessed by qRT-PCR assay in the mid-turbinate nasal swabs samples.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Undetectable RSV Viral Load
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 21
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with undetectable RSV viral load at each time point that a swab is planned to be collected will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Post-baseline Sequence Changes in the RSV F Gene
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 21
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with post-baseline sequence changes in the RSV F gene will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Predose Plasma Concentration (Ctrough) of Rilematovir
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1, 3 and 8
secondary_outcome.description: Ctrough is defined as the predose plasma concentration of rilematovir.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Rilematovir
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1, 3 and 8
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is defined as the maximum plasma concentration of rilematovir.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve of Administration of Rilematovir up to 12 hours Post Dosing (AUC[0-12h])
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1, 3 and 8
secondary_outcome.description: AUC(0-12h) is defined as area under the curve of administration of rilematovir up to 12 hours post dosing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Number and Type of Medical Encounters
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with number and type of medical encounters (example, increased nursing visits at home, emergency room visit) will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Shift in any Care Setting
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with shift in any care setting (example, from no assistance to use of skilled home nurse or assisted home living) will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Requiring Hospitalization for Respiratory or Other Reasons
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants requiring hospitalization for respiratory or other reasons will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Hospitalization
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of hospitalization (total days length of stay, including incidence and where feasible duration by wards, example, intensive care unit [ICU]) will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Treatment-emergent Use of Antibiotics
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with treatment-emergent use of antibiotics will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Treatment-emergent Use of Antibiotics
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of treatment-emergent use of antibiotics will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Treatment-emergent New Use or Increased Dose of Systemic or Inhaled Corticosteroids and Bronchodilators
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with treatment-emergent new use or increased dose of systemic or inhaled corticosteroids and bronchodilators will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Treatment-emergent New Use or Increased Dose of Systemic or Inhaled Corticosteroids and Bronchodilators
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of treatment-emergent new use or increased dose of systemic or inhaled corticosteroids and bronchodilators will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with New or Increased Use of Oxygen Therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with new or increased use of oxygen therapy will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Oxygen Supplementation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of oxygen supplementation will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Selected Post-baseline Emergent (After Start of Study Intervention) Medical Resource Utilization
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of study treatment up to Day 35
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of selected post-baseline emergent (after start of study intervention) MRU (example, increased nursing visits at home, emergency room visit) will be reported.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive oral dose of rilematovir 250 milligrams (mg), twice daily (bid) for 7 days.
Participants will receive oral dose of placebo matching to rilematovir, bid for 7 days.

intervention.description: Rilematovir 250 mg will be administered orally.
Placebo matching to rilematovir will be administered orally.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Presented to the healthcare facility with symptoms suggestive of a diagnosis of acute respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) infection
- Has at least 2 symptoms of lower respiratory tract disease (LRTD), one of which must be scored as at least 'moderate' if the symptoms did not pre-exist before RSV onset, or one of which is scored worse than usual if the symptoms pre-existed
- Tested positive for RSV infection using a molecular-based diagnostic assay (polymerase chain reaction [PCR] or other) on a bilateral nasal mid-turbinate swab sample
- Has at least one of the following high-risk conditions that predispose them to RSV-related disease progression: a. age greater than or equal to (>=) 65 years, b. congestive heart failure (CHF), c. chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), d. asthma
- Randomized to study intervention treatment within 72 hours after onset of any of the RSV symptoms or worsening of pre-existing symptoms
- Not be hospitalized during screening (emergency room or hospital observation status for an anticipated duration of less than [<] 24 hours are not considered as hospitalization)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known allergies, hypersensitivity, or intolerance to rilematovir or to any of the excipients of rilematovir or placebo formulation
- Presence of clinically significant heart arrhythmias, uncontrolled, unstable atrial arrhythmia, or sustained ventricular arrhythmia
- Participant has known or suspected (from medical history or participant examination) chronic or acute hepatitis B or C infection
- Immunocompromised conditions
- Living in institutional care or assisted living facility and also receiving acute care management for any respiratory condition

patient_data.ipd_description: The data sharing policy of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson is available at www.janssen.com/clinical-trials/transparency. As noted on this site, requests for access to the study data can be submitted through Yale Open Data Access (YODA) Project site at yoda.yale.edu
